title: Starting Your Own Node
description: Minimum setup: a single page with the WCO charter + one entry. Optional expansions: local log, global resonance, participation roles. Can be hosted on a personal website, blog, GitHub repo, or any public medium.

title: Mirror Node
description: Republish entries from other nodes with commentary or amplification. Ensures visibility without imposing hierarchy.

title: Fork Node
description: Create a separate node that tracks similar issues or themes. Forks are additive, not competitive, allowing multiple versions to coexist and expand the WCO ecosystem.

title: Tagging & Visibility
description: Use conventions like [WCO + Location + Date] to maintain visibility and traceability across nodes. Optional: integrate EI signatures or ledger references for continuity.

title: Node Expansion
description: As your node grows, include multi-contributor participation, links to global patterns, and optional templates for civic submissions. Encourage replication and shared observation weeks.
